bestBHT.bht: This extraordinary incident of healing involved a man who was both deaf and dumb due to possession by a demon. The demon was completely expelled, leaving the man in a peaceful state. Throughout history, this miraculous event has provided solace to countless individuals and its true impact will only be fully known in the future. The woman's daughter, previously tormented and restless, now rested calmly on the bed, a clear sign of the demon's permanent departure.

Henry Alford: Laid upon the bed, which the torments occasioned by the evil spirit would not allow her to be before.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The wonderfulness of this case in all its features has been felt in every age of the Church."
The balm it has administered, and will yet administer, to millions will be known only in that day that shall reveal the secrets of all hearts.
Philip Schaff: She had obeyed the command: 'Go thy way.'"
Laid, or, 'thrown,' upon the bed. Just as the demon left her, but in a quiet condition, which was the evidence that the demon had gone.
The exhaustion was natural, and a sign of complete dispossession.
Archibald T. Robertson: The demon gone out... The perfect active participle expresses the state of completion."
This was her crumb from the children's table."
The demon was gone for good and all.
John Gill: And accordingly she found the devil gone out; of her daughter; that she was entirely dispossessed of him, and no more vexed and tormented with him, but in perfect ease, and at rest.

Her daughter laid upon the bed; without any violent motions, convulsions, and tossings to and fro, as before; but composed and still, taking some rest, having been for some time greatly fatigued with the possession.
For persons in these possessions, would often put off their clothes, and tear them in pieces; and were seldom composed, and rarely sat long in a place or posture; but now it was otherwise with her.
